channel.title: Questions about making a new java file
channel.description:
Ok, I am wondering what all i would have to do to make a new Java file that handles clue scrolls.
I know how to make the file, my question is: AFTER i am DONE with the file, and it compiles successfully, will it work with the case numbers and such, or will I have to edit something in some other files? Need further info? Ask.

item.title: Questions about making a new java file

item.title: Questions about making a new java file
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

What do you mean declare it in client.java? Put the code that is in the new file in client.java? Or what do you mean?

Here is the file I have created so far:

Name: cluescrolls

[code]import java.io.*;

public class cluescrolls {
public void buryItem(int item, int slot, int ID) {
boolean used = true;
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID];
if (item != c.playerItems[slot] - 1){
return;
}
if (c.playerHasItem(item)) {
switch (item) {

case 2680:
c.sendMessage(“I can only open this where home sweet home is.”);
break;

case 952:
if(c.absX == 3240 && c.absY == 9363 && c.playerHasItem(2680)){
c.deleteItem(2680, c.getItemSlot(2680), 1);
c.addItem(2830, 1);
c.sendMessage(“You find a casket!”);
}
c.sendMessage(“You dig…”);
c.setAnimation(409);
break;

case 2830:
c.deleteItem(2830, c.getItemSlot(2830), 1);
c.addItem(Item.randomClue(), 1);
break;

		default:
			used = false;
			break;
			}
		}
	}
}[/code]

There are no errors compiling, but the code does not work.

Read full topic
item.source: Questions about making a new java file

item.title: Questions about making a new java file
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:1, topic:236544”]Ok, I am wondering what all i would have to do to make a new Java file that handles clue scrolls.

I know how to make the file, my question is: AFTER i am DONE with the file, and it compiles successfully, will it work with the case numbers and such, or will I have to edit something in some other files? Need further info? Ask.[/quote]

No, you must declare it in your client.java in order for the process to work. Then in your new file.java you will have to add c.example to everything that you are trying to add. obj, ect

That will tell your run.cmd and compiler that the new notepad you made is really in your client.java but making a new file just makes the coding more neater/nicer. You don’t really have to make a new notepad if you don’t want to. There is really no point.

Read full topic
item.source: Questions about making a new java file
